description: Decimal expansion of square root of 27.
comments: Continued fraction expansion is 5 followed by {5, 10} repeated. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 20096 + sqrt(27) represents the surface of a dodecahedron of side equal to one. S = 3*a^2(2 + sqrt(3)) with a = 1. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 10 2010
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(27); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b010482.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A040021 Continued fraction. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
